website_summaries.verdict: This ball has it all – good grip, great bounce, and engineered symmetry. Just be sure to keep it indoors.
pros: Composite microfiber cover for superior grip, tack, and control
Patented cushion control technology creates a softer feel, truer bounce, and longer life
Symmetrical engineering for balanced ball and bounce
cons: Feels tacky at first, but doesn't take long to break in

customer_reviews.title: Good basketball!
customer_reviews.text: This ball has a good grip and has lasted a long time for me. I have used it almost exclusively indoors, only outdoors a handful of times on dry courts. Do a camelcamelcamel on this product, for the price changed significantly right after I bought it, which was just before Christmas; after the holiday, it was a super-bargain at $20, so much so that I thought about buying a second one!
customer_reviews.author: brifd1

customer_reviews.title: the Best
customer_reviews.text: Great grip on this ball. I wish it were a lil less expensive but its the best ball I have ever used for coaching High School. You wont find a better basketball with grip that lasts for years. Ive tried the Rock, Spalding, Wilson but those tend to become slick after a year or two of use. The Baden ball is consistently playable. I have been recommending it to other coaches. I coach AAU and every game we have, this ball is chosen by the referees over the other teams ball everytime. Get at least one of these for gametime because of cost.
customer_reviews.author: TKnowledge

customer_reviews.title: Good but Wilson evolution is better
customer_reviews.text: Someone stole my Wilson evolution, so I thought I would give this a try while I was looking for a new ball. Feels good until you get some dust on it, the grip is completely gone after that until you get some sweat on your hands. The evolution got better the more you used it, and lasted a good 2 years before showing wear. This is fading after 6 months of light playing 3 or 4 times a week.
customer_reviews.author: Lu

customer_reviews.title: It's the only basketball I will ever use.
customer_reviews.text: The title says it all. I dislike leading with that, but this one is a no-brainer. With the Wilson Evolution, I do not like the soft padding. Other Spalding basketballs don't feel right. Balden Elite has the perfect weight, right bounce, and excellent grip. Durability is exceptional. Break-in point is about 1-3 months depending on how much you play and how you train. I train, do drills, and play 3-4 times a week, 3 hours per day. I couldn't be more satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Elann

customer_reviews.title: Good indoor ball
customer_reviews.text: I received this ball about a week ago, I play 2-3 times a week. Out the box, the ball feels great & has a very round feeling. The seams are separated wider than most balls which I assume gives it the symmetrical round feeling. It has a tacky feel but does need broken in. The ball has a thin film out the box which makes it kind of slippery. Once broken in I believe this ball will have excellent grip.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Young

customer_reviews.title: very nice
customer_reviews.text: this is probably my favorite ball. probably over the wilson evolution. In comparison to the evolution, the ball feels a little lighter..and it has a softer feel compared to the evolution. Other than that, both balls are great to use. I've had this ball for over a year now and I use it at least 4 times a week for about 2 to 3 hours in the gym. the ball still looks good and still retains it's shape. the ball has lost some air here and there but no problem once i pumped it again and tends to retain it pretty well unless i'm away from home and it doesn't get used. Very nice ball overall
customer_reviews.author: plucky xiongchianeng

customer_reviews.title: Best Indoor Game Ball Today
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this ball after carefully reading reviews on Amazon and am not disappointed. We use the ball twice a week in a rec league. We used to use Spalding TF-1000s and were disappointed when they recently (2 or 3 years ago) changed the design. My last Spalding wore out and lost its grip very quickly. I do not like the feel of the Wilson Evolution so purchased the Baden instead. It broke in quickly and has a good grip without being too tacky. The other players really like it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... of different styles of the evolution and what I liked about this ball is that out of the box ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used a lot of different styles of the evolution and what I liked about this ball is that out of the box it is soft and ready to be used. The bounce is better than all the other ones out there. My only complaint is that the ball is slightly lighter than the other balls used at our gym so after using this as the primary ball for practice, everyone goes back to the evolution for the game balls and adjusting your shot because they are heavier. I do like the quality and would recommend this to the average player who is not doing a lot of game play but for just practice.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Aced

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Find
customer_reviews.text: This ball has the best set of features without any obvious flaws. It's got the right feel/grip, texture, bounce, symmetry, weight and size. It comes fully inflated. It's better than anything in its price range. Indoor ball. A common fault of Wilson and Spalding are large slick areas where logos are printed. Not an issue with the Baden Elite. A good ball all the way around.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Clemmons

customer_reviews.title: Great ball, fresh leather that is smooth and very ...
customer_reviews.text: Great ball, fresh leather that is smooth and very slightly pebbled. !00% indoor use only, this will last years when used with care and you do not use as a chair!!! I woudl imagine this ball will last less than 6 months if you use it outside, which i recommend you don't but if you do it will be the best ball on the court for its short lifetime. your choice. BALL IS LIFE
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My son’s favorite basketball!
customer_reviews.text: My 12 yo son loves this ball and all the other kids in practice always want to use it, too. It’s so soft and just feels like it’s better quality than comparable brands. It’s definitely his favorite and the only ball we buy when he needs a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: S. King

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the quality and performance of this ball.
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this ball. It’s not the first time we’ve purchased this same ball. Now he keeps one specifically for indoor use alone and one that takes a bit more of a beating on outdoor courts. It has a nice feel and grip to it.
customer_reviews.author: MommaME

customer_reviews.title: Bought this as a Christmas present to myself since my ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas present to myself since my old Evolution had lost it's grip. I'm used to basketballs coming in boxes but this one was just in a plastic bag with no box. Strange but the ball seems okay. The gym is packed for the next few weeks so I'll have to wait to use it before commenting on the performance. Due to people on break and new years resolutioners that take over the court until mid January.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain  "Steve"

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Evolution
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best ball I’ve ever owned. I’ve been using it at my local la fitness for the past year and a half and the grip is still amazing. In my opinion it’s better than the Wilson Evolution. Most evo’s start to wear down within a year of continuous use but this Baden ball doesn’t. It takes a little to break in, which took longer for me because I did it by myself instead of using it in games, but once you do the grip is sensational. I would definitely recommend this ball this anyone that’s looking to buy an indoor basketball.
customer_reviews.author: UnknownCelebrity

customer_reviews.title: Most under rated ball
customer_reviews.text: Best basketball I’ve ever had. It’s much better then a evolution ball. This ball is super under rated. And it comes inflated. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: RoqueMiguelGarcia

customer_reviews.title: Poor Product
customer_reviews.text: Already goes flat overnight. Never used outside. Maybe 20 hours total usage on indoors court. Still can pump up and use for her workout but should we really have to for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Watts

customer_reviews.title: Best baskeball on the marketI
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I would only use it indoor though. Soft touch and good grip.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Always gets taken as GAME BALL
customer_reviews.text: INDOOR BALL. It has great grip, doesn't deflate (even came inflated), and bounces nicely. CONS: Always gets picked for game ball, so when I'm not playing (after losing a full-court game), I have nothing to practice with! Or just someone else's crappy ball.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Very High Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this ball because of the wonderful earlier reviews. The issue they had with the valve leaking air has been completely taken care of. I rarely have to add air. I play basketball 3 mornings a week...and the guys were reluctant to use it...preferring the Evolution, but once I "forced" it on them, they have taken a very strong liking to it. Well constructed with moderate grip and perfect feel, and doesn't seem to show any signs of wear yet. I definitely recommend this high quality product. Price right too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Basketball on the Court
customer_reviews.text: As a high school basketball coach, I don't think we've ever used a better ball. It has both a great grip & great feel that definitely adds to the control that a player has while dribbling & shooting. It almost feels lighter than other balls but when compared on a scale, it's not. Recommend this ball over the Wilson & Spalding equivalent versions and we know use it as our game balls as well.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It must be a nice ball because somoene already stole it.
customer_reviews.author: Keith McGrew

customer_reviews.title: He has the Evolution ball but really like the handle and feel of the Baden Elite
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this ball for my 17 yr old baller. He has the Evolution ball but really like the handle and feel of the Baden Elite. He said he can feel a difference when playing with the Baden. He really lines the ball.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal Mendez

customer_reviews.title: A good purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Baden Elite 28.5" ball for my 8 year old son. The ball has been in use for almost 2 months. I've played high school and college basketball and I'm familiar with quality product. The ball is durable, has a nice grip and a comfortable feel. I would purchase again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great Grip, Keeping an Eye on Inflation
customer_reviews.text: This ball seemed to lose a little air after first inflating, but the second round of inflation has held for about 2 months now. As long as there aren't problems with the ball losing air, this is a great indoor basketball - awesome grip, design, etc. I play ball about 2-3 times/week and take it somewhat seriously, so hopefully that gives some context to my review.
customer_reviews.author: htm

customer_reviews.title: VERY INCONSISTENT BOUNCE
customer_reviews.text: The ball looks very nice and symmetrical. It has a soft feel like a Wilson evolution. However, the ball has a very inconsistent bounce to it (doesn’t bounce the way you’d expect it to) so if you’re a pg trying to do anything slightly fancy you can forget about it. Many times you get a half step or a step on someone then the ball will just bounce weird and gives the defender a chance to catch up. Baden lied when they said they focused on the CONSISTENCY of the bounce.
customer_reviews.author: Jaytee Zamora

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Ball
customer_reviews.text: I have always loved the Wilson Evolution and decided to give this a try. My son loves it. He is in a basketball club and they use this ball out of all the balls for the games. Seems to have a little better grip then the Wilson, but very comparable. Great Ball.
customer_reviews.author: JKP

customer_reviews.title: Too sticky at first. Breaks in later on
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance on this ball. I have always bought the Wilson Evolution. This ball was extremely sticky in the beginning. But after a few weeks of constantly playing with it, it has broken in and feels much better now.
customer_reviews.author: Ecks T

customer_reviews.title: Love Baden
customer_reviews.text: We love this brand of basketball, but this one in particular does not meet our expectations. It constantly deflates so we keep pumping it up. It’s leaking air somewhere/somehow.
customer_reviews.author: caryn brown

customer_reviews.title: I love this ball
customer_reviews.text: I love this ball, very grippy when brand new but it seems like the tackiness has faded but probably just needs a good wipe down. This ball is a little more firm than the wilson evolution or the tf1000, which I prefer.
customer_reviews.author: M.BH.P.

customer_reviews.title: Very Grippy
customer_reviews.text: Good ball but it is very grippy/tacky when you first get it. I had to use it on the concrete to break it in. It is the go-to rock for our games. Very similar to the Wilson Evolution, but I like this one better.
customer_reviews.author: Big Perm

customer_reviews.title: As good as any top tier ball
customer_reviews.text: purchased for indoor use only about 2 weeks ago - youth travel basketball league. The Baden logo is a little slippery, but it should not have any significant impact on player performance. Ball bounces nicely, good grip - love the unique look as everyone else has the Evolution...so easy to not "lose". To me - as good as any top tier indoor only ball (Wilson Evolution, Rawlings NFHS, and Baden Elite)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Our school uses Baden exclusive to other brands
customer_reviews.text: Cost is a major deciding factor when working on a limited budget. the availability for next day delivery and cost went into our decision making. Other than that, the ball is great and well used by the school team.
customer_reviews.author: KgArthr

customer_reviews.title: Very well made ball for the indoor player.
customer_reviews.text: Ball is super grippy, great court feel, and super even bounce. I would recommend this ball for any indoor court player regardless of skill. If you're deciding between this and the wilson evo, I would personally go with this ball as the bounce is superior to the evo. Though the evo may be a tad softer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good feel, durable, just doesn't have deep channels
customer_reviews.text: The Baden Elite ball is a good ball but not the greatest. I'll take it over the POS Wilson Evolution you see everywhere that everyone likes to use though as that ball is soft, slippery trash. Only thing about this ball is the channels are not deep so the ball feels more rounded than most. But it has good feel and I pretty durable at retaining air as I play almost daily.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Ching

customer_reviews.title: Balltastic!
customer_reviews.text: Great ball for even bounce and good grip. Love their products and while Wilson is still good, when we play with both, the Baden is second to none.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah D.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Ball
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice ball. feels good in the hand. Best suited for indoor use. The exterior texture is that of very soft leather. It is not highly textured. The feel is smooth and silky, but I can still palm it no trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Muehlmann

customer_reviews.title: Great ball
customer_reviews.text: Overall really good ball. I like it a lot and it works just as well or better than any other ball on the market. It does have a lighter and grippier feel to it compared to the Wilson evolution. Good enough to be a game ball, but if your team uses a different ball overall it might be difficult to go back and forth. If you are just looking for a solid overall ball for yourself though this one is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with quality of ball I received....
customer_reviews.text: After having this ball for less than 2 months it has really worn down a lot. For the price and good reviews I thought it would be better quality. It has only been used in an indoor wooden court by my 12 year old daughter for training. Right now I would not buy again. Maybe I received a defective or poor quality ball.
customer_reviews.author: Tek

customer_reviews.title: Awesome basketball!
customer_reviews.text: My 14yr old son loves this basketball. He says it has a great grip to it. The first one he had lasted a good 3 years of everyday use! Great quality! It is hard to find in stores! So glad Amazon had it available. Highly recommend for your athlete!
customer_reviews.author: lisa q.

customer_reviews.title: Baden Elite is a Great Basketball with Grip After it's Broken-in
customer_reviews.text: I really like this ball. I've had it for almost 2 months. It is a little slick/slippery until you break it in. I've noticed this with most newer indoor balls. I expect the grip to get better and better the more I use it. I do not have any complaints. If you are thinking about getting this ball, go ahead, because you won't find anything better. I've owned a Wilson Evolution and it is very comparable. You can't go wrong with either.
customer_reviews.author: Rio

customer_reviews.title: The problem is that they seem to "disappear" during the course of the season so I wanted something that couldn't be taken "by mi
customer_reviews.text: I run a men's hoops league and we've used The Rock for the last couple of years. The problem is that they seem to "disappear" during the course of the season so I wanted something that couldn't be taken "by mistake" and these received good review so tried them. Right out of the box they were tacky and true. Positive feedback from all players.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Ball!!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT Ball!! I play ball 3 times a week and we most often use Wilson Evolution and that is what most of the guys like, but I think that once this ball gets broken in, it will be the "go-to" ball.
customer_reviews.author: GoatMan

customer_reviews.title: Have played with both this ball and the Wilson evolution this ball is far superior.
customer_reviews.text: Have played with both this ball and the Wilson evolution this ball is far superior.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Very good ball
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough about this ball. I play 3 times a week and this ball is Soo much better then my Wilson evolution. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tome P.

customer_reviews.title: Leaking air
customer_reviews.text: Ball came and won’t hold air. Have not heard back from supplier
customer_reviews.author: Diane Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Ball feels great, maybe even better than the competition
customer_reviews.text: This ball looks and feels great, and at a nice price. You do have to break it in though, out of the box it feels a bit sticky, but that goes away after a couple hours.
customer_reviews.author: Ian B.

customer_reviews.title: Great durability, lasted close to 2 years!!
customer_reviews.text: i love this basketball!! after a week or two of balling the grip really sets in. perfect for people who sweat a lot, it doesn’t affect your game as the other balls i’ve have tend to be slippery after sweat gets on it! lol
customer_reviews.author: darius

customer_reviews.title: General
customer_reviews.text: Bought a few days, all sorts of venues have basically gone, say next advantage and disadvantage. The advantage is that the ball bounces well and the skin is soft and feels good. At first, the surface is a little bit waxy, so the ash is a little slippery. After a few days, it's gone. The downside is that the ball is too cheap.
customer_reviews.author: John  Graves

customer_reviews.title: Great ball
customer_reviews.text: Awesome... Move aside Evolution... this ball is the best ball I've used in 37 years of playing basketball. Its soft, but not too soft. Its tacky, but not too tacky. It feels GREAT.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C

customer_reviews.title: Better than the Evolution IMO...
customer_reviews.text: Everyone I know plays with the Wilson Evolution. I prefer this one even though most haven't heard of it. I like the grip. It feels great. Buy this if you want something different if not better than the Wilson Evolution.
customer_reviews.author: An Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: The True Basketball
customer_reviews.text: My daughter's review: "I am 7 years old. It was great for my hand size. It was good for dribbling. I had a lot of fun trying to shoot in my net. It was nice and orange like a basketball. The air didn't come out when I dribbled on the rocks."
customer_reviews.author: Clove Creek

customer_reviews.title: Great Ball
customer_reviews.text: Great ball. The Evolution is more common, and kids often think of it as the gold standard. However I find the Evolution a little too soft. This ball is a bit firmer to the touch, but it has a nicer bounce off the court, rim and glass. When we need to provide a game ball, we always turn to this ball.
customer_reviews.author: Ordinary Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great ball, but needs to be worn in a little before playing
customer_reviews.text: It is a little hard and tacky when first arriving, need to wear it down a little. Could be a little bit softer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great ball...too bad we brought it to an outdoor 3x3
customer_reviews.author: T. O'Neal

customer_reviews.title: You won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Great feel and nice shooters ball - great grip - superb
customer_reviews.author: ARB in NH

customer_reviews.title: I have purchased a few balls in the past for my sons and I have to say that this one is by far on of the better balls I have pur
customer_reviews.text: I got this ball for my 10 year old son. He loves it. He evens sleeps with it. When he took it to his travel practice the kids wanted to play with his ball vs the wilson evolution. I have purchased a few balls in the past for my sons and I have to say that this one is by far on of the better balls I have purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Deshawn nolan

customer_reviews.title: Great indoor ball
customer_reviews.text: This is what my daughter uses for indoor game warm-ups. Glad we got it, but wish it wasn't $50, but that's the going rate I saw elsewhere too.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: One of the better indoor basketballs
customer_reviews.text: One of the better indoor basketballs. I have played with a lot of different balls but this is one of my favorites. I was nervous because typically I have only bought wilson or Spalding game balls but I am very happy with this game ball! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sonny

customer_reviews.title: Best Ball Ever
customer_reviews.text: I love this ball! So much nicer and better feel than the Wilson!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy L Martin

customer_reviews.title: Works great !
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Make sure to clean it often with soap, water, and a brush to keep it from getting slick
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this basketball
customer_reviews.text: Love this basketball!! Best one that I have ever used and the one that we always choose to play with at the rec center! It has held up very well and still has better grip than the new ones the rec center gets and I have been using it almost every day for almost a year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really great feel and bounce. I like it better the evolution and tf1000.
customer_reviews.author: N. Earl

customer_reviews.title: Great quality basketball
customer_reviews.text: Great quality basketball. Bought it for my 12 year daughter who plays on a Select basketball team. It is the same brand our high school teams use. She loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Nicky Z

customer_reviews.title: While the ball has plenty of traction, it handles ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the Baden official version of this ball but received the a girls ball. Call to Amazon for a refund and ordered a Wilson bb. Go with Wilson! Used it twice as of now and very impressed with the grip and texture of the Wilson ball.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff La

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: Not expensive but very good quality for a ball. My teen loves it and said to get another
customer_reviews.author: Brandi L. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Poor packing - ink stains on ball
customer_reviews.text: This ball game with these two ink smudges on it. I assume they are ink smudges as they look like finger smudges and the ball was packed in a shipping box only and was not in a Baden box for example. It seems someone working in packaging just smudges it. Really lowers the wow factor of my new expensive ball. I would like a partial refund.
customer_reviews.author: lex

customer_reviews.title: Best indoor game ball around
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Basketball. best grip best feel, its our goto basketball for indoor play
customer_reviews.author: MegaMind

customer_reviews.title: Best indoor bball I've ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bball for my son. Best indoor bball I've ever purchased. Game Quality.. Excellent Grip and Feel.
customer_reviews.author: rblymier

customer_reviews.title: This has unique grip and a very nice ball. My son likes it better than the ...
customer_reviews.text: This has unique grip and a very nice ball. My son likes it better than the Evolutions we have but I will say the logos on it are slippery and we'll see how it ranks vs the Evolutions once worn in a bit. I'd say 4.5 as of now.
customer_reviews.author: SarahM

customer_reviews.title: Game ball of choice for ball sessions
customer_reviews.text: Best ball I've found to date after swearing by the old school TF-1000s. I've tried the new TF-1000, Wilson Evolution, Solution, Nike Elite, and have settled on the Baden Elite. Very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great Tackiness and bounced well!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this ball and I didn't even have to break in the ball. The grip was excellent, bounced great, and the ball felt great coming off my fingers. EXCELLENT BALL! I am only upset that I bought it for $62 and then the price dropped to 59. I have played with both the Wilson Evolution and now this Baden Elite. I like the feel of the material of the Evolution, but I like the Baden's grip and overall shooting feel better.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Miller

customer_reviews.title: Seam separation with 2 months INDOOR use
customer_reviews.text: Hey! Baden! What's up with your poor product? Used only INDOORS on wood gym floor 2 dozen times and I have a seam peel. Other than a very expensive game ball coming apart it was great for play. My advise, pick another brand.
customer_reviews.author: B.Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Just takes a while to break in but Great ball all around
customer_reviews.text: Came in a good size box and was wrangled in plastic and came fast and the ball came with perfect air and ball is great just needs to get broken it more once I use is a lot then it should be broken in and everyone at my gym seems to love this ball
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Baden is great product with 1 year warranty. I would encourage you to purchase locally or directly from Baden as Amazon only gives you 30 day return window. I had a defective bladder in ball and Amazon would do nothing.....Baden will replace with new because of their 1 year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: todd h petersen

customer_reviews.title: Top of the Line Quality Basketball
customer_reviews.text: This ball has a small break in period to become perfection but immediately it has a premium feel and has just the right amount of bounce and grip. I appreciate this over the Wilson Evolution just because they are so few and far between. This is a great ball at a great Amazon price. I highly recommend for indoor players!
customer_reviews.author: Buster Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great ball for youth basketball
customer_reviews.text: What a great basketball, very durable but has great handle, we coach junior boys basketball 8-9 yr olds and they request using this ball, mostly for the grip and control.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Won't find a better basketball
customer_reviews.text: This is perhaps the best basketball I have ever had the pleasure of owning or playing with. It's a close call between this ball and the old TF-1000' before they changed them. I'd take this one over all others and you should too
customer_reviews.author: Stanton S.

customer_reviews.title: Best Ball on the Court
customer_reviews.text: Wilson Evolution, The Rock, Spalding 1000 and Baden are all choices for the kids at practice (Travel/ AAU) and the Baden is the preferred ball.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C

customer_reviews.title: Great bounce and a nice feel. Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: This basketball has a nice bounce to it and a great feel. It's hard to describe it any other way. Better than another brand I bought. I hate to wear it out, so I'm saving this for indoor gyms rather than street cement LOL!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan B

customer_reviews.title: Better than any indoor bball you will find for this price.
customer_reviews.text: I love this ball. It's kind of like the evolution but with better bounce. It has become my perferred indoor basketball. Time will tell if he has longevity but definitely a must have for basketball enthusiast.
customer_reviews.author: John D.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great basketball. The tact is good enough that I can palm it (like the official ball, but not like many others), and it has a perfectly round spin. I really like playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: sportlivin

customer_reviews.title: Favorite ball
customer_reviews.text: Grandsons favorite ball and he has a lot of them
customer_reviews.author: John Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding indoor ball. Very please with the quality. ...
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding indoor ball. Very please with the quality. A shooters ball.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Williams

customer_reviews.title: Excellent indoor ball
customer_reviews.text: Excellent indoor ball. The grip and feel of the ball is perfect for indoor play. I prefer this basketball to the Wilson Evo.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Berenguer

customer_reviews.title: What an amazing ball. I was on the fence between this ...
customer_reviews.text: What an amazing ball. I was on the fence between this ball and the Wilson Evolution. I have no regrets at all!
customer_reviews.author: TeeDub

customer_reviews.title: My favorite ball
customer_reviews.text: I geek out on basketballs and this is one of my favorites. Fells soft like the Wilson Evo but is much tackier for better grip. Best bang for your buck out there.
customer_reviews.author: G Gatchalian

customer_reviews.title: Great Ball
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this ball. Wanted to get a good indoor ball and this one is perfect. Only used a handful of times, so far.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Best ball I’ve ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Awesome basketball. I love the grip. Best ball I have ever owned. Always the ball selected for games. Way better than my evolution.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Tortorello

customer_reviews.title: My favorite ball to play with
customer_reviews.text: I play with a group of guys. This is the go to ball that we all want to use when we play in a game.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Meek

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but net
customer_reviews.text: Best indoor ball I have played with. I've tried at least three other 'premium' indoor balls. This ball is awesome, and I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: smo

customer_reviews.title: The best there is
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing basketball! I have loved playing with the wilson evolution that everyone else has. This past week everyone wanted to play with this basketball over their evolutions. It's soft yet grippy and is an excellent game ball. You won't regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy O.

customer_reviews.title: Best Basketball NSHA around
customer_reviews.text: Compared to the Wilson Evolution (soft feel) and the Spalding T1000 (very firm); the Baden Lexum Elite is just right and durable. The Ball of choice of our High School Team and AAU organization. I heard the new TF1000 has improved but Baden is still a bettter ball especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: NappyG

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and symmetry.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and symmetry. It took about 8 sessions at the gym to completely break it in, but is a great ball.
customer_reviews.author: BJammin2

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Basketball!
customer_reviews.text: This basketball is amazing! It dribbles, passes, and shoots very well; feels amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Srenee

customer_reviews.title: The cushion and grip on this ball is much better than the evolution
customer_reviews.text: The cushion and grip on this ball is much better than the evolution , I wanted to get this ball because everyone had the evo and I wanted to be different and I have heard nothing but good things from people who have played with it . The Price was a steal about 12 bucks cheaper than the evo as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Baden May Have Created Perfection With This Ball!!!
customer_reviews.text: What a tremendous basketball. It holds its air, and the air valve being under the skin of the ball is a nice touch. This ball has one of the truest bounces I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Hawkeyes43

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly great feel
customer_reviews.text: Everyone seems to like the Wilsons or even the Spaldings, but I'm pleasantly surprised by this Baden basketball. Really nice material gives it a nice tackiness. Hopefully word spreads that this ball is actually better than its competitors so that we'll see more of them out in the gyms.
customer_reviews.author: D21

customer_reviews.title: awesome basketball
customer_reviews.text: Really like the great feel and texture of the ball, which helps shooting accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: point guard 65

customer_reviews.title: Sticky
customer_reviews.text: Sticky, sticky, sticky. If you like a grippy grip, this is the ball for you. I own this & an Evolution, & this is 10x better. IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Nakajami55

customer_reviews.title: Best indoor Game ball you can get.
customer_reviews.text: BEST BBALL OUT THERE RIGHT NOW.......way better than any spalding!
customer_reviews.author: swade11

product_meta.title: Baden Elite Indoor Game Basketball
product_meta.description: The Baden Elite Indoor Game Basketball is our Top-Of-The-Line composite leather basketball in which we have dedicated the last (30 years) to perfecting. It was designed specifically for the Elite player looking for a premium indoor basketball that provides maximum consistency and playability. You'll immediately feel the difference the first time you pick up this basketball. The Elite’s proprietary, advanced microfiber cover creates the perfect tack that won't absorb moisture, gain weight or discolor like many other basketballs on the market. To ensure you'll never get a bad bounce, we've engineered the basketball with our patented Cushion Control Technology (CCT), which embeds thousands of tiny air cells in the carcass, as well as our Stealth Soft-Valve System (SSS), which reduces the amount of exposed rubber from the valve stem and softens the entire valve panel. The Elite Indoor Basketball is also the only basketball on the market with a true symmetrical design giving the ball perfect balance and consistency. The Elite is approved by the (NFHS) and is the official basketball of many AAU, leagues, and state high-school associations across the country.
feature_bullets: DESIGN - The Elite’s proprietary composite microfiber cover provides superior grip and tack for optimum basketball control. Its patented Cushion Control Technology (CCT) creates a softer feel, truer bounce, and longer life
PERFECTION - The Elite’s Perfection Symmetrical design was engineered to provide a perfectly balanced ball and its smooth rounded edges ensure you won’t feel lumps or get inconsistent bounces

ADVANTAGE - This is a basketball that you can trust from the inside out. Whether you’re putting in hours practicing your free throws, passes, or draining three’s, this ball will help you reach your full potential on the court
AVAILABLE - Intermediate Size 6 (28.5”) and Official Size 7 (29.5”), NFHS Approved and Ships Fully inflated

ELITE - Baden’s Elite basketball with a moisture grip gives you superior ball control throughout your game, You can only achieve Perfection by designing for athletes, using the best raw materials and paying attention to every detail
